task.title: Changing a user policy’s weight
task.shortdesc: Each Sametime policy has a weight assigned to it. The weight should be unique. When assigning a weight to a policy, please ensure the weight is unique on each policy and not duplicated.

context.p: By default, users will get the policy with the highest weight.

For example,if no changes are made to the default configuration, the default policy has a weight of 1, and the anonymous policy has a weight of 0. If a user were to login, they would receive the default policy with weight of 1.
For more information on how Sametime handles finding more than one policy for a user, please see the topic Policy Behaviors.

p.note: Do not change the weight on the default or anonymous policies.

step.cmd: Open the policies.user.xml file with a text or XML editor.
Ensure you are in the correct policy inside the file. Look for the line that begins with policy id=”YourCustomPolicy”.

info.p: Where “YourCustomPolicy” is the name of the policy you wish to modify.

step.cmd: Change the weight to the desired weight number. The higher the weight, the higher the precedence.
